initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".
stories: Police dispatched an armoured vehicle to breach the cabin of a tractor-trailer on a Texas highway after the driver refused to stop or exit the cab when officers tried to deploy tire deflation devices. The armoured vehicle then smashed a window, allowing officers to throw in a gas canister and subsequently remove the driver from the vehicle. The motives behind the high-speed chase remain unclear, but authorities reported that the driver employed erratic driving tactics, frequently changing lanes and swerving. The Harris County Sheriff speculated that the driver might have been impaired, but the exact cause is still unknown.

Police sent an armored car to break into a tractor-trailer on a Texas highway after the driver refused to stop or leave the cab when officers tried to use tire deflation devices. The armored car then crashed a window, allowing officers to throw in a tear gas canister and later remove the driver from the vehicle. Although the reason for the high-speed chase is unclear, authorities stated that the driver drove erratically, frequently changing lanes and swerving. Authorities also suspect the driver might have been impaired, but the exact cause remains unknown.

A heavily armored vehicle was dispatched to forcibly enter a tractor-trailer on a Texas highway after its driver refused to halt or exit the cab following attempts by police to deflate the tires. The armored vehicle subsequently broke a window, allowing officers to deploy a tear gas canister inside and subsequently extract the driver from the vehicle. While the motivation behind the high-speed pursuit remains unclear, authorities reported that the driver displayed reckless behavior, rapidly shifting lanes and making erratic turns. Additionally, authorities suspect the driver may have been impaired, but the exact reason remains undetermined.
